Model equation as a function of DBH or DBA

Description: Refers to the specific taxonomic level for which the equation was developed (species, genus, family or plant group)
Species for which the allometry was developed
Geographic location from which trees were sampled to develop the original equation
Minimun DBH sampled to develop the equation
Maximun DBH sampled to develop the equation
N trees sampled to develop the equation
Mass unit used in original publication

Method used to develop the allometry. Traditionally, this is done by harvesting whole trees, drying, and weighing ("harvest").  However, we anticipate that many future allometries will be developed using ground-based LiDAR ("lidar").
Regression type used in original publication
Indicates if a correction factor (CF) or a relative standard error (RSE) was included in model
CF for the specific equation, pulled from original publication, if included
Unique reference identification number for allometry source. Links to Reference table.
